tp.pr5.items

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr5.items.Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Item>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockItem, PlaceableItem

    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Item>, java.lang.Cloneable
    The superclass of every type of item.
    It contains the common information for all the items and it defines the interface that the items must match One item is defined by a name and a description.
    Each item has one effect that is performed when the method use() is executed. You can revert that effect with revert()
    Author:
    Abel Serrano Juste

    • Method Detail

      • canBeUsed

        public abstract boolean canBeUsed()
        Checks if the item can be used. Subclasses must override this method
        Returns:
        true if the item can be used

      • use

        public abstract boolean use(RobotEngine r,
          NavigationModule nm)
        Try to use the item with a robot in a given place. It returns whether the action was completed. Subclasses must override this method
        Parameters:
        r - The robot that uses the item
        nm - The navigation module for knowing where WALL·E uses the item.
        Returns:
        true if the action was completed. Otherwise, it returns false

      • revert

        public boolean revert(RobotEngine r,
             NavigationModule nm)
        Revert the effect of the item under the robot engine and the navigation module.
        It's the opposite of use() and it's needed to undo operate instructions.
        Parameters:
        r - The robot that u the item
        nm - The navigation module for knowing where WALL·E used the item.
        Returns:
        true if the action was completed. Otherwise, it returns false
        * It's expected it always return true if we're reverting a valid previous use()
